role_details.title: Full Stack Development Intern (IIoT & Data Analytics Platform)

responsibilities: Contribute to frontend (Angular) and backend (Node.js, Express) modules
Work with time-series data using InfluxDB and Redis
Build and integrate real-time APIs and data pipelines
Collaborate in sprint planning, code reviews & product discussions
Write clean, modular, and well-documented code

technical: Familiarity with MongoDB or similar NoSQL databases
experience: At least one full stack project

preferred_attributes: Exposure to IoT, InfluxDB, Redis, or MQTT/Kafka
Experience with Docker, Git, or CI/CD
Interest in time-series data & cloud-native development

github_profile_summary.bio: A Full-Stack Developer on the outside and a Dev-Ops enthusiast on the inside.

repositories.name: Encoder-Transformer-From-Scratch-in-C
repositories.description: An implementation of the Transformer model from the 'Attention is All You Need' paper, built entirely from scratch in C, covering self-attention, positional encoding, and feed-forward networks.

repositories.name: Code-Collab
repositories.description: A real-time collaborative code editor for pair programming and group sessions, featuring live code sharing and multi-language support. Consists of a Next.js frontend and a Node.js backend with HTTP and WebSocket servers.

repositories.name: briefer
repositories.description: A collaborative, Notion-like platform for creating data notebooks and dashboards using Python and SQL, featuring scheduling, native visualizations, and AI-powered code generation.

repositories.name: AI-Racer-Speed_-_Control
repositories.description: A project to develop and train an AI agent for the CarRacing-v2 environment using reinforcement learning, specifically the Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO) algorithm, to optimize driving strategies.

repositories.name: Grok-Code
repositories.description: A conversational AI command-line interface (CLI) tool powered by the Grok model, designed for interacting with a codebase using natural language commands.

repositories.name: LoopAI-Assignment
repositories.description: A data ingestion API system built with FastAPI for processing data IDs in batches, featuring priority queue handling and rate limiting.

evaluation_table.evidence: The candidate's projects 'Code-Collab' and 'briefer' use Next.js and React for the frontend. There is no direct evidence of experience with Angular.
evaluation_table.comments: The candidate is highly proficient in modern frontend development with React/Next.js, demonstrating the ability to build complex UIs. However, there is a direct gap in the required Angular framework.

evaluation_table.evidence: Multiple repositories ('Code-Collab', 'briefer', 'Grok-Code') utilize Node.js for the backend. The profile explicitly lists Node.js as a skill.
evaluation_table.comments: The candidate demonstrates extensive and practical experience in building Node.js backends for full-stack applications and CLI tools.

evaluation_table.evidence: The profile lists SQL as a skill, and the 'briefer' project appears to use a SQL database (PostgreSQL mentioned in architecture). There is no direct evidence of experience with MongoDB, InfluxDB, or Redis.
evaluation_table.comments: The candidate has foundational database experience with SQL, but lacks specific experience with the NoSQL (MongoDB) and time-series (InfluxDB, Redis) databases required for this IIoT role.

evaluation_table.evidence: The candidate has at least two significant full-stack projects: 'Code-Collab' (real-time code editor) and 'briefer' (data notebook platform), both with distinct frontend and backend components.
evaluation_table.comments: Exceeds the requirement of one full-stack project with multiple, complex, and well-documented applications.

evaluation_table.evidence: The candidate lists TypeScript (a superset of JavaScript) as a skill and uses it in projects like 'Code-Collab' and 'Grok-Code'. The use of Node.js, React, and WebSockets ('Code-Collab') demonstrates a strong command of web technologies.
evaluation_table.comments: Demonstrates mastery of modern JavaScript (via TypeScript) and core web technologies essential for a full-stack role.

evaluation_table.evidence: The entire profile is on GitHub, showing proficiency with Git. Docker is listed as a skill and is used in multiple projects ('Code-Collab', 'briefer', 'LoopAI-Assignment'), with Dockerfiles and docker-compose files visible in the 'briefer' repository.
evaluation_table.comments: Strong, practical evidence of using both Git for version control and Docker for containerization, aligning with preferred attributes.

evaluation_table.evidence: The 'LoopAI-Assignment' project is a data ingestion API. The 'Code-Collab' project uses WebSockets for real-time communication, which is conceptually similar to MQTT. The 'briefer' project architecture includes a dedicated Node.js API service.
evaluation_table.comments: Proven experience in building APIs and working with real-time communication protocols, which is a strong indicator of the ability to work with MQTT and REST APIs.

evaluation_table.evidence: The bio 'Dev-Ops enthusiast' and extensive use of Docker align with cloud-native development. The 'briefer' project shows a strong interest in data analysis. However, there is no direct experience with IoT, InfluxDB, or Redis.
evaluation_table.comments: Strong alignment with the DevOps and cloud-native aspects. The interest in data is clear, but the candidate lacks specific exposure to the IIoT and time-series technologies mentioned in the JD.

key_strengths: Exceptional backend development skills with Node.js, demonstrated across multiple complex projects.
Exceeds requirement for full-stack project experience with several well-documented, real-world applications.
Mastery of modern web technologies, including TypeScript, and strong practical experience with Git and Docker.
key_gaps: No direct experience with the required Angular frontend framework; proficiency is in React/Next.js.
Significant gap in experience with the specified databases: MongoDB, and particularly the time-series databases InfluxDB and Redis.
Lack of direct exposure to IoT-specific protocols and technologies.
final_assessment.rationale: The candidate is a highly capable full-stack developer with a strong foundation in backend development, DevOps practices, and complex project execution, resulting in a 75% match. While there are significant technology gaps in Angular and the specific time-series databases (InfluxDB, Redis) required for the IIoT domain, their demonstrated ability as a quick learner and success with diverse, challenging projects suggest a high potential to adapt and master the required stack.
